title: Gamepad fixes, NACK tone on failed direction request
message:
Gamepad fixes, NACK tone on failed direction request

Gamepad dispatchKeyEvent method was "swallowing" keypresses that did not
pertain to ED.  Unfortunately this included the MENU button on older
devices.  Changed code so that all keypresses not in the gamePadKeys[]
are passed to the super for processing.

Changed code so repeat count is processed for each individual
gamePadKeys[] value rather than for all keys at once.  Similar to the
change above, this allows repeat to flow through for keys not in
gamePadKeys[].

changeDirectionIfAllowed() now returns a boolean indicating whether the
throttle direction matches the requested direction.  Gamepad uses this
return value to generate the "NACK" audio feedback tone on a throttle
direction that isn't honored (due to preference settings and current
speed).

title: New Gamepad repeat handling and sound feedback.  Refactoring
message:
New Gamepad repeat handling and sound feedback.  Refactoring

Added Gamepad speed button repeat handling so now the effective repeat
rate and speed step size are the same as for the Increase/Decrease speed
buttons.  Previously the only option was the repeat rate generated by
the Gamepad itself, which I found was too high.  (For safety the Gamepad
speed autorepeat uses a separate (but similar) mechansim from the screen
Up/Down keys, although this could be revisited later.)

Added more audible Gamepad keypress sound feedback by using the
ToneGenerator instead of playing the SoundEffect CLICK.  The sound
generation is now encapsulated to make future changes easier.  A
different tone is used when Throttle hits hi/lo limits or on an invalid
press (for instance Next Throttle is pressed when only one throttle is
active).  The feedback volume level will track the device volume setting
but there is also a feedback volume preference which can be used to
reduce keypress sound relative to the device volume setting if desired.

Added Activity result code definitions for clearer handling of results.
Gamepad settings now only updated when preferences are changed, instead
of in OnResume.

Refactoring of some code in Throttle and Preference classes to improve
code modularity and simplify methods.

title: JmdnsImpl tolerates lack of joinGroup() support
message:
JmdnsImpl tolerates lack of joinGroup() support

The Jmdns implementation calls java.net.MulticastSocket.joinGroup() to
open a MulticastSocket.  The codes was crashing when this method was
missing from an Android 2.3.5 OS build.  I added a test for the presence
of this method in JmdnsImpl, via reflection, and simply omit the
joinGroup call when the method is missing.

title: Refresh Routes/Turnouts on any Preference activity
message:
Refresh Routes/Turnouts on any Preference activity

Turnout and Route activities now update their lists upon return from the
Preferences menu, rather than on specific messages from the Preferences
activity.  This change provides a simple way to ensure the displayed
lists and options always reflect the current preferences, even if new
prefs are added in the future, without requiring specific messages from
the Preference activity for each change.  Elimiinated the
LOCATION_DELIMITER and HIDE_IF_NO_USER_NAME messages.

title: Add SelectiveLeadSound preference

Add SelectiveLeadSound preference

Added a new preference for EngineDriver consists that controls whether
Bell / Whistle / Horn functions route to just the Lead loco (default) or
to all locos in the consist.

title: Improved reconnect behavior.  Decreased TCP socket connect timeout from 3…
message:
Improved reconnect behavior.  Decreased TCP socket connect timeout from 3 seconds to 1 second to speed up the reconnect attempt rate - needs testing to confirm that is enough time to get a socket open on all devices.

Fixed WiT heartbeat so that both inbound and outbound heartbeats stop reliably during shutdown.  Corrected position of removeNotification in onResume for all Activities to ensure proper shutdown.  Filter which messages go to Activities when shutting down to speed things up.

Screens with webViews now load a static page in onPause and remove it in onResume to ensure that javascript doesn't continue to run when the screen is paused.

title: Added Reconnect Status screen.  During WiT_RETRY, the Reconnect Status screen is…
message:
Added Reconnect Status screen.  During WiT_RETRY, the Reconnect Status screen is display.  If Reconnection is successful (WiT_RECONNECT) then Locos and Consists are restored, ED returns to the previous Activity, the view is refreshed, Webviews reloaded to their prior state, etc.

Since Android does not reliably report Socket status, the only way to tell when the connection is lost is by attempting to send.  We do that at an outbound heartbeat rate that is calculated from the Heartbeat.  To ensure detection of a lost connection, I changed the behavior so that ED uses a default outbound heartbeat rate when the WiT heartbeat is disabled.  Since we currently allow WiT 4 seconds to respond, the time to detect a loss of connection can be long.  

Android does not seem very fast to reconnect to a network after losing the connection.  So although the reconnection process is automatic now, the time to reconnect to WiT seems quite a bit longer than desired.

title: Updated the socket reconnection logic to better handle brief wifi dropouts or AP…
message:
Updated the socket reconnection logic to better handle brief wifi dropouts or AP switching.  When a socket read or a write fails, ED now checks the socket once/second to see if it has become ok.  If the socket becomes ok within 4 seconds, ED resumes normal operation.  Otherwise the socket disconnect/reconnect sequence is initiated.
